Class EventStreamBase<S>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.reactfx.EventStreamBase<S>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - type of the subscriber
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BiEventSource, EventSource, LazilyBoundStreamBase, TriEventSource

extends java.lang.Object

      • forEachSubscriber

        protected final void forEachSubscriber(java.util.function.Consumer<S> action)

      • reportError

        protected final void reportError(java.lang.Throwable thrown)

      • firstSubscriber

        protected void firstSubscriber()
        Called when the number of subscribers goes from 0 to 1. Overriding this method is a convenient way for subclasses to handle this event.

        This method is called after the newSubscriber(Object) method.

      • newSubscriber

        protected void newSubscriber(S subscriber)
        Called for each new subscriber. Overriding this method is a convenient way for subclasses to handle this event, for example to publish some initial events.

      • noSubscribers

        protected void noSubscribers()
        Called when the number of subscribers goes down to 0. Overriding this method is a convenient way for subclasses to handle this event.

      • oversee

        protected final Subscription oversee(EventStream<?> stream)
        Forwards errors reported by the given stream to this stream.
        Returns:
        subscription that can be used to stop forwarding the errors.

      • subscribeTo

        protected final <T> Subscription subscribeTo(EventStream<T> stream,
                                             java.util.function.Consumer<? super T> subscriber)
        Subscribes to the given event stream by the given subscriber and also forwards errors reported by the given stream to this stream.
        Returns:
        subscription used to unsubscribe subscriber from stream and stop forwarding the errors.

      • subscribeTo

        protected final <A,B> Subscription subscribeTo(BiEventStream<A,B> stream,
                                               java.util.function.BiConsumer<? super A,? super B> subscriber)
        Subscribes to the given event stream by the given subscriber and also forwards errors reported by the given stream to this stream.
        Returns:
        subscription used to unsubscribe subscriber from stream and stop forwarding the errors.

      • subscribeTo

        protected final <A,B,C> Subscription subscribeTo(TriEventStream<A,B,C> stream,
                                                 TriConsumer<? super A,? super B,? super C> subscriber)
        Subscribes to the given event stream by the given subscriber and also forwards errors reported by the given stream to this stream.
        Returns:
        subscription used to unsubscribe subscriber from stream and stop forwarding the errors.
